metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10109 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Twisted Web through 19.10.0, there was an HTTP request splitting vulnerability. When presented with a content-length and a chunked encoding header, the content-length took precedence and the remainder of the request body was interpreted as a pipelined request.

criterions.comment: twisted: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
